classes.name: File
classes.description: An abstract representation of file and directory pathnames. Provides methods for examining and manipulating files and directories.

constructors.description: Creates a new File instance by converting the given pathname string into an abstract pathname.
Creates a new File instance from a parent pathname string and a child pathname string.
Creates a new File instance from a parent abstract pathname and a child pathname string.

methods.name: exists

returns.description: True if the file or directory exists

methods.description: Tests whether the file or directory denoted by this abstract pathname exists.

methods.name: isFile

returns.description: True if this pathname denotes a normal file

methods.description: Tests whether the file denoted by this abstract pathname is a normal file.

methods.name: isDirectory

returns.description: True if this pathname denotes a directory

methods.description: Tests whether the file denoted by this abstract pathname is a directory.

methods.name: getName

returns.description: The name of the file or directory

methods.description: Returns the name of the file or directory denoted by this abstract pathname.

methods.name: getPath

returns.description: The pathname string

methods.description: Converts this abstract pathname into a pathname string.

methods.name: getAbsolutePath

returns.description: The absolute pathname string

methods.description: Returns the absolute pathname string of this abstract pathname.

methods.name: getCanonicalPath

returns.description: The canonical pathname string

methods.description: Returns the canonical pathname string of this abstract pathname.

methods.name: getParent

returns.description: The pathname of the parent directory, or null

methods.description: Returns the pathname string of this abstract pathname's parent, or null if it has no parent.

methods.name: getParentFile

returns.description: The abstract pathname of the parent directory, or null

methods.description: Returns the abstract pathname of this abstract pathname's parent, or null if it has no parent.

methods.name: length

returns.description: The length, in bytes, of the file

methods.description: Returns the length of the file denoted by this abstract pathname.

methods.name: lastModified

returns.description: The time the file was last modified, in milliseconds since epoch

methods.description: Returns the time that the file was last modified.

methods.name: list

returns.description: An array of strings naming the files and directories, or null

methods.description: Returns an array of strings naming the files and directories in this directory.

methods.name: listFiles

returns.description: An array of abstract pathnames, or null

methods.description: Returns an array of abstract pathnames denoting the files in this directory.

methods.name: mkdir

returns.description: True if the directory was created

methods.description: Creates the directory named by this abstract pathname.

methods.name: mkdirs

returns.description: True if the directory was created, along with all necessary parent directories

methods.description: Creates the directory named by this abstract pathname, including any necessary parent directories.

methods.name: delete

returns.description: True if the file or directory was deleted

methods.description: Deletes the file or directory denoted by this abstract pathname.

methods.name: renameTo

returns.description: True if the renaming succeeded

methods.description: Renames the file denoted by this abstract pathname.

methods.name: canRead

returns.description: True if the file can be read

methods.description: Tests whether the application can read the file denoted by this abstract pathname.

methods.name: canWrite

returns.description: True if the file can be written

methods.description: Tests whether the application can modify the file denoted by this abstract pathname.

methods.name: createNewFile

returns.description: True if the file was created, false if it already exists

methods.description: Atomically creates a new, empty file named by this abstract pathname if it does not yet exist.

methods.name: createTempFile

params.name: prefix
params.description: The prefix string for the temp file name (at least three characters)

params.name: suffix
params.description: The suffix string, or null to use ".tmp"

returns.description: An abstract pathname denoting a newly created empty file

methods.description: Creates an empty file in the default temporary-file directory.

methods.name: toString

returns.description: The pathname string

methods.description: Returns the pathname string of this abstract pathname.

fields.name: separator
fields.description: The system-dependent name-separator character as a string.

fields.name: pathSeparator
fields.description: The system-dependent path-separator character as a string.

classes.name: InputStream
classes.description: Abstract class representing an input stream of bytes. Subclasses must provide an implementation of the read() method.

methods.name: read

returns.description: The next byte of data, or -1 if the end of the stream is reached

methods.description: Reads the next byte of data from the input stream.

methods.name: read

params.name: b
params.description: The buffer into which the data is read

returns.description: The total number of bytes read, or -1 if end of stream

methods.description: Reads some number of bytes from the input stream and stores them into the buffer array.

methods.name: read

params.name: b
params.description: The buffer into which the data is read

params.name: off
params.description: The start offset in array b

params.name: len
params.description: The maximum number of bytes to read

returns.description: The total number of bytes read, or -1 if end of stream

methods.description: Reads up to len bytes of data from the input stream into an array of bytes.

methods.name: available

returns.description: An estimate of the number of bytes that can be read without blocking

methods.description: Returns an estimate of the number of bytes that can be read without blocking.

methods.name: close
methods.description: Closes this input stream and releases any system resources associated with the stream.

methods.name: skip

params.name: n
params.description: The number of bytes to be skipped

returns.description: The actual number of bytes skipped

methods.description: Skips over and discards n bytes of data from this input stream.

methods.name: mark

params.name: readlimit
params.description: The maximum limit of bytes that can be read before the mark position becomes invalid

methods.description: Marks the current position in this input stream.

methods.name: reset
methods.description: Repositions this stream to the position at the time the mark method was last called.

methods.name: markSupported

returns.description: True if this stream supports mark and reset

methods.description: Tests if this input stream supports the mark and reset methods.

classes.name: OutputStream
classes.description: Abstract class representing an output stream of bytes. Subclasses must provide an implementation of the write(int) method.

methods.name: write
methods.description: Writes the specified byte to this output stream.

methods.name: write
methods.description: Writes b.length bytes from the specified byte array to this output stream.

methods.name: write

params.name: off
params.description: The start offset in the data

params.name: len
params.description: The number of bytes to write

methods.description: Writes len bytes from the specified byte array starting at offset off to this output stream.

methods.name: flush
methods.description: Flushes this output stream and forces any buffered output bytes to be written out.

methods.name: close
methods.description: Closes this output stream and releases any system resources associated with this stream.

classes.name: FileOutputStream
classes.description: A file output stream for writing data to a File. Writes raw bytes; for writing characters, consider using OutputStreamWriter.

params.name: file
params.description: The file to be opened for writing

constructors.description: Creates a file output stream to write to the specified File object.

params.name: file
params.description: The file to be opened for writing

params.name: append
params.description: If true, bytes are written to the end of the file

constructors.description: Creates a file output stream to write to the specified File, with the option to append.
Creates a file output stream to write to the file with the specified name.

params.name: append
params.description: If true, bytes are written to the end of the file

constructors.description: Creates a file output stream to write to the file with the specified name, with the option to append.

methods.name: write
methods.description: Writes the specified byte to this file output stream.

methods.name: write
methods.description: Writes b.length bytes from the specified byte array to this file output stream.

methods.name: write

params.name: off
params.description: The start offset in the data

params.name: len
params.description: The number of bytes to write

methods.description: Writes len bytes from the specified byte array starting at offset off.

methods.name: flush
methods.description: Flushes this output stream and forces any buffered output bytes to be written out.

methods.name: close
methods.description: Closes this file output stream and releases any system resources associated with this stream.

methods.name: getChannel

returns.description: The file channel associated with this file output stream

methods.description: Returns the unique FileChannel object associated with this file output stream.

methods.name: getFD

returns.description: The file descriptor object associated with this stream

methods.description: Returns the file descriptor associated with this stream.

classes.name: BufferedOutputStream
classes.description: Implements a buffered output stream. Writes are buffered in memory and flushed to the underlying output stream in larger blocks for efficiency.

constructors.description: Creates a new buffered output stream to write data to the specified underlying output stream with a default buffer size of 8192 bytes.
Creates a new buffered output stream to write data to the specified underlying output stream with the specified buffer size.

methods.name: write
methods.description: Writes the specified byte to this buffered output stream.

methods.name: write

params.name: off
params.description: The start offset in the data

params.name: len
params.description: The number of bytes to write

methods.description: Writes len bytes from the specified byte array starting at offset off to this buffered output stream.

methods.name: flush
methods.description: Flushes this buffered output stream, forcing any buffered bytes to be written to the underlying output stream.

methods.name: close
methods.description: Closes this buffered output stream and releases any system resources associated with the stream.

classes.name: InputStreamReader
classes.description: A bridge from byte streams to character streams. Reads bytes and decodes them into characters using a specified charset.

constructors.description: Creates an InputStreamReader that uses the default charset.

params.name: charsetName
params.description: The name of a supported charset

constructors.description: Creates an InputStreamReader that uses the named charset.

methods.name: read

returns.description: The character read, or -1 if end of stream

methods.description: Reads a single character.

methods.name: read

params.name: offset
params.description: Offset at which to start storing characters

params.name: length
params.description: Maximum number of characters to read

returns.description: The number of characters read, or -1 if end of stream

methods.description: Reads characters into a portion of an array.

methods.name: ready

returns.description: True if the next read() is guaranteed not to block

methods.description: Tells whether this stream is ready to be read.

methods.name: getEncoding

returns.description: The name of the character encoding being used, or null

methods.description: Returns the name of the character encoding being used by this stream.

methods.name: close
methods.description: Closes the stream and releases any system resources associated with it.

classes.name: OutputStreamWriter
classes.description: A bridge from character streams to byte streams. Characters written to it are encoded into bytes using a specified charset.

constructors.description: Creates an OutputStreamWriter that uses the default character encoding.

params.name: charsetName
params.description: The name of a supported charset

constructors.description: Creates an OutputStreamWriter that uses the named charset.

methods.name: write
methods.description: Writes a single character.

methods.name: write

params.name: off
params.description: Offset from which to start writing characters

methods.description: Writes a portion of an array of characters.

methods.name: write

params.name: off
params.description: Offset from which to start writing characters

methods.description: Writes a portion of a string.

methods.name: flush
methods.description: Flushes the stream.

methods.name: getEncoding

returns.description: The name of the character encoding being used, or null

methods.description: Returns the name of the character encoding being used by this stream.

methods.name: close
methods.description: Closes the stream, flushing it first.

classes.name: BufferedReader
classes.description: Reads text from a character-input stream, buffering characters for efficient reading of characters, arrays, and lines.

constructors.description: Creates a buffering character-input stream with a default-sized input buffer.
Creates a buffering character-input stream with a buffer of the specified size.

methods.name: read

returns.description: The character read as an integer, or -1 if end of stream

methods.description: Reads a single character.

methods.name: read

params.name: off
params.description: Offset at which to start storing characters

params.name: len
params.description: Maximum number of characters to read

returns.description: The number of characters read, or -1 if end of stream

methods.description: Reads characters into a portion of an array.

methods.name: readLine

returns.description: A String containing the contents of the line, or null if end of stream

methods.description: Reads a line of text. A line is terminated by a line feed, carriage return, or carriage return followed by a line feed.

methods.name: ready

returns.description: True if the next read() is guaranteed not to block

methods.description: Tells whether this stream is ready to be read.

methods.name: mark

params.name: readAheadLimit
params.description: Limit on the number of characters that may be read while still preserving the mark

methods.description: Marks the present position in the stream.

methods.name: reset
methods.description: Resets the stream to the most recent mark.

methods.name: markSupported

returns.description: Always returns true for BufferedReader

methods.description: Tells whether this stream supports the mark() operation.

methods.name: close
methods.description: Closes the stream and releases any system resources associated with it.

methods.name: skip

params.name: n
params.description: The number of characters to skip

returns.description: The number of characters actually skipped

methods.description: Skips characters.

classes.name: Serializable
classes.description: Marker interface that enables serialization of a class. Classes that implement this interface allow their instances to be serialized and deserialized. Has no methods or fields.
